todos.title: Pattern Recognition
todos.body: To retrieve a pattern in your memory you must provide the pattern you want to retrieve.  Fortunately you don't have to have the entire pattern to retrieve it, only a portion.  Patterns are stored in a hierarchy.

todos.title: Experts
todos.body: Recognizing patterns on patterns.

todos.title: Prediction
todos.body: Is best when you have multiple sensors providing information.  Prediction is when people fit existing ideas into new frameworks.

todos.title: Sequencing
todos.body: Collapsing patterns into named objects.  You don't need to know every detail but you do need to know if a change occurs in the sequence.

todos.title: Intelligence
todos.body: Capacity to remember and predict patterns in the world.

todos.title: Saccade
todos.body: Your eye fixates on one point and jumps to another.  Happens about three times a second.  Vision is more like a song than a painting.

todos.title: Patience
todos.body: When you don't know how to proceed, often the best strategy is to make no changes until your options become clear.'

todos.title: Hebbian Learning
todos.body: Two neurons that fire at the same time wire together.

todos.title: Language
todos.body: Through language one human can evoke memories and create new juxtapositions of mental objects in another human.

todos.title: Parallel
todos.body: Thinking, predicting, and doing all happen at the same time, not one at a time.

todos.title: Senses
todos.body: There are way more than five senses (motion, color, luminance, pressure, temperature, pain, vibration, joint sensors, gut, inner ear).

todos.title: Paul Erdos
todos.body: The simplest mathematical proogs already exist in some thereal book and a mathematician's job was to find them.

todos.title: Age
todos.body: The more you know the less you remember.  Once you are exposed to the same non-important things over and over, you are less likely to remember the details of it.  This is why children can easily remember trivial things such as signs because it is a novel experience to them.

todos.title: Feedback
todos.body: The brain is saturated with feedback connections.

todos.title: Cortex
todos.body: The brain has layers that information passes through to make sense and to create what you need.

todos.title: Columns
todos.body: The brain has columns in it to carry out different tasks or storage.  Many can be activated at once but eventually the brain picks a winner.

todos.title: Stored Intelligence
todos.body: The brain doesn't just compute problems, it retrieves the answers from memory it stored a long time ago.

todos.title: Simplicity
todos.body: The best solutions to scientific problems are simple and elegant.

todos.title: Creativity
todos.body: Taking something and applying it to a different field or situation.  The way to be more creative is to assume that there is an answer to the problem and then letting your mind wander.

todos.title: Kludge
todos.body: Programs written without foresight.

todos.title: Hear What We Want to Hear
todos.body: Our brains fill in what they miss with what they expect to hear.

todos.title: Artificial Intelligence
todos.body: Machines won't be to able to do what humans do because they don't have sexual urges, hunger, pulse, muscles, emotions.  Humans are much more than intelligent machines.

todos.title: In-betweeners
todos.body: Like a telephone network, there is not a single connection from every neuron to another, the connections pass through high capacity lines and then spread out at the end.

todos.title: Context
todos.body: Information and language cannot be understood without context.

todos.title: Variation
todos.body: Computers are terrible at handling variation.
